definitions: To take in and incorporate as one's own; absorb.
To make similar; cause to resemble.
To take into the mind and thoroughly comprehend.
To convert (food) into a form that can be absorbed and incorporated into the body.
examples: Children often assimilate new information quickly.
Immigrants may struggle to assimilate into a new culture.
The body will assimilate the nutrients from the food.
He tried to assimilate the complex ideas presented in the lecture.
